channel.title: I'm afraid of the dark
channel.description: Yea. I can't just stand alone in the dark, I feel like something is going to attack me. I dont know how to get past this, as my mom is telling me this is one of the weird things that you should have outgrown by now... Anyways can I have any advice? Don't be mean to me either please :s

item.title: I'm afraid of the dark
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:16, topic:428835”][quote author=lostmyphat link=topic=531527.msg3883781#msg3883781 date=1326256381]

I notice shadows in my room when i lay in the bed, but I’m vision impaired.

Close your eyes and shove your head under th blanket leaving only a hole for your nose to stick out, it works for me.

That just makes me more vulnerable.
[/quote]
Nooo, the blankets hiding you gawsh…[/quote]
I lolled^.

Gl phat, hope you can overcome this:(. Tbh I get scared at times too(when i don’t wear my glasses cause i’m pretty blind which makes me feel vulnerable in most situations) but all I do is just use my sense of logic. Nothing is there so its safe and I do whatever task anyways, hope I helped. Must be horrable for you.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm afraid of the dark
item.dc:creator: @frozon566 frozon566
item.description:
@frozon566 wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:42, topic:428835”]Become what is feared in the dark. Sounds crazy but it worked for me. DO NOT LISTEN TO ME I AM NOT RELIABLE FOR WHAT HAPPENS WHEN YOU DO THIS Now that that is out of the way…

How I got over my fear of the dark is to become what was feared in the dark, most people think ghosts or goblins but where I grew up it was people who had fucked up problems and would kill for pleasure (not gang banger, just regular people). So I took one night a week, grabbed a knife, and just walk around (knife in my pocket of course). I did it in pitch blackness so I could just face my fear head on. When I got older I started borrowing on of the old swords mounted around my house and put it on my back and took walks in the forest which were another thing that scared me when I was younger. I’m now over both of those things and take walks in them regularly to relax and think.

Inb4 I’m crazy (I already know, don’t have to say it.)[/quote]

yea ghosts and goblins aren’t real but wolves and bears are

Read full topic

Still not sure if not troll

but I wonder why the hell u guys are scared in the dark O.O
I mean the chance that anything happens is like really small and even if something happens whats the worst that could happen?
like a burglar hitting you, ok yh it’s not that you are dead because of it, and even then you will not know it anymore o.o

item.title: I'm afraid of the dark
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Become what is feared in the dark. Sounds crazy but it worked for me. DO NOT LISTEN TO ME I AM NOT RELIABLE FOR WHAT HAPPENS WHEN YOU DO THIS Now that that is out of the way…

How I got over my fear of the dark is to become what was feared in the dark, most people think ghosts or goblins but where I grew up it was people who had fucked up problems and would kill for pleasure (not gang banger, just regular people). So I took one night a week, grabbed a knife, and just walk around (knife in my pocket of course). I did it in pitch blackness so I could just face my fear head on. When I got older I started borrowing on of the old swords mounted around my house and put it on my back and took walks in the forest which were another thing that scared me when I was younger. I’m now over both of those things and take walks in them regularly to relax and think.

Inb4 I’m crazy (I already know, don’t have to say it.)

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @ww3 ww3
item.description:
@ww3 wrote:

PriMaL_PvP:

It may be an experiance or situation you enountered while in the dark in your early childhood, ask anyone that may know of this and try reliving this moment. Such fears start at childhood and End at Childhood also

This is true, this is how I became afraid of the dark when I was little.

Read full topic
